pullRequest.title: KAFKA-9553: Improve measurement for loading groups and transactions
pullRequest.bodyText:
Changes:

Pull out sensor update to top-level
Shifted up the partition-loading sensor measurement for loading transactions
Added scheduler-time awareness for loading groups

Tests:

Modified test to reflect new scheduling call

Ops:

 Modify docs/ops.html; update metric description to include scheduling time.

Committer Checklist (excluded from commit message)

 Verify design and implementation
 Verify test coverage and CI build status
 Verify documentation (including upgrade notes)

nodes.bodyText: not sure that we should default the time to 0. I think we should let the caller pass in value they want.
nit: move it after info line. Maybe get rid of variable altogether and put is on the method call itself.
no need to have a default value for the parameter.

commit.message:
KAFKA-9553: Improve measurement for loading groups and transactions

- Pull out sensor update to top-level
- Shifted up the partition-loading sensor measurement for loading transactions
- Added scheduler-time awareness for loading groups
- Modified test to reflect new scheduling call
Review: removed default values for parameters
Fixed build errors due to non-default parameter in tests

afterCommit.message: Fixed build errors due to non-default parameter in tests

nodes.bodyText: nit: break this into multiple lines.
Hmm.. Does this do what's intended? Wouldn't time.milliseconds only be evaluated when the callback is invoked?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -521,20 +521,20 @@ class GroupMetadataManager(brokerId: Int,
     val topicPartition = new TopicPartition(Topic.GROUP_METADATA_TOPIC_NAME, offsetsPartition)
     if (addLoadingPartition(offsetsPartition)) {
       info(s"Scheduling loading of offsets and group metadata from $topicPartition")
-      scheduler.schedule(topicPartition.toString, () => loadGroupsAndOffsets(topicPartition, onGroupLoaded))
+      scheduler.schedule(topicPartition.toString, () => loadGroupsAndOffsets(topicPartition, onGroupLoaded, time.milliseconds()))

nodes.bodyText: nit: Conventionally, we would drop In and make this schedulerTimeMs. A few more of these in the patch.
nit: maybe we could call this something more descriptive like scheduleStartMs
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -435,7 +435,8 @@ class TransactionStateManager(brokerId: Int,
       info(s"Completed loading transaction metadata from $topicPartition for coordinator epoch $coordinatorEpoch")
     }
 
-    scheduler.schedule(s"load-txns-for-partition-$topicPartition", loadTransactions)
+    val nowInMs = time.milliseconds()

commit.message: Review: cache the timestamp before passing in to the scheduler callback

nodes.bodyText: nit: maybe we call this totalLoadingTimeMs for consistency
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -393,11 +388,16 @@ class TransactionStateManager(brokerId: Int,
       loadingPartitions.add(partitionAndLeaderEpoch)
     }
 
-    def loadTransactions(): Unit = {
+    def loadTransactions(startTimeMs: java.lang.Long): Unit = {
+      val schedulerTime = time.milliseconds() - startTimeMs
       info(s"Loading transaction metadata from $topicPartition at epoch $coordinatorEpoch")
       validateTransactionTopicPartitionCountIsStable()
 
       val loadedTransactions = loadTransactionMetadata(topicPartition, coordinatorEpoch)
+      val endTimeMs = time.milliseconds()
+      val timeLapse = endTimeMs - startTimeMs

commit.message: Review: updated description of partition-load metric to mention inclusion of "scheduling time"

nodes.bodyText:
I think the short description is ok as it was. But maybe we could add something like this to the long description:

maximum time, in milliseconds, it took to load offsets and group metadata from the consumer offset partitions loaded in the last 30 seconds (including time spent waiting for the loading task to be scheduled)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1070,22 +1070,22 @@

Security Considerations for Remote Mon Disconnected|SyncConnected|AuthFailed|ConnectedReadOnly|SaslAuthenticated|Expired. - Max time to load group metadata + Max time to load group metadata (including scheduling time)
